nodes.text: Hewl was an astronomical object located within the Hewl system, a part of the Mid Rim's Eidoloni sector. Karap Valley was located on Hewl, and it featured fog banks that were considered to be infamous by the Rebel Alliance Lieutenant Colonel Palpatine Essex Yerac.

At some point by 2 ABY, Yerac was tracking an independent bounty hunter group through the fog banks of Karap Valley. While there, the Rebel officer unexpectedly encountered the Filar-Nitzan infiltrator Vacander, who told Yerac to cease the pursuit of the bounty hunters. In a subsequent addendum to an Alliance SecuriDex datafile on Vacander, Yerac mentioned the encounter with the Filar-Nitzan on Hewl.

Hewl was first mentioned in Alliance Intelligence Reports, a 1995 sourcebook for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed the Hewl system, and therefore the celestial body Hewl, in grid square M-16.
